result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Demichael D Walker

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Demichael D Walker in court.  Attorney Joel H. Rosenthal in court for Demichael D Walker.  Prosecuting attorney Nate Kristian McClure in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for pretrial conference. 
Defense counsel has received discovery and an offer from the state. Defense requests resolution date. Case adjourned to Branch 13.
Parties are advised that effective 10/31/2022, pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-17, this case will be reassigned to Branch 37, Judge Dee in Room 515 of the Courthouse.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 7, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Demichael D Walker in court.  Attorney Joel H. Rosenthal not in court.  Prosecuting attorney Samuel Tyler Tabin in court for the State of Wisconsin. Status conference held. Attorney Rosenthal unable to appear, spoke with Clerk earlier in the morning. Case is adjourned in Branch 13.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
CORRECTION: Judge Konkol presided over Branch 13 on August 31st, 2022

Defendant Demichael D Walker in court.  Prosecuting attorney Nate Kristian McClure in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a pre-trial conference. Defendant does not have counsel at this time. 
Case adjourned to allow time for defendant to obtain an attorney.
Status conference scheduled for September 30, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON 8/12/2022. IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR, A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Defendant Demichael D Walker in court.  Gregg Herman as well as student intern Josh Rather, under the student practicde rule, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Reserve Judge, Branch 13. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel. Defendant does not qualify for Public Defender representation. Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 13.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 31, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 08/10/2022@2pm
